attributes.action: Disapprove plans to frack in North Yorkshire
attributes.background: Plans to frack just half a mile from the picturesque North Yorkshire village have been approved by North Yorkshire County Council, despite 4000-strong opposition. This isn't ruling on popular opinion; instead this is elitism and these plans have to be disapproved, for the safety of the local people.
attributes.additional_details: Campaigners have reacted with fury and dismay after North Yorkshire county councillors approved plans to carry out hydraulic fracturing at Kirby Misperton, near Malton. The eleven-member Planning Committee voted 7 votes to 4 to grant planning permission to Third Energy to frack just ½ mile from the picturesque North Yorkshire village. Over 1,000 people attended an anti-fracking rally outside the meeting at County Hall on Friday 20th at Northallerton, but to no avail.

attributes.action: The DfT should urgently plan and fund a mass transit system for Leeds
attributes.background: Leeds is the largest city in western Europe without a mass transit system. Leeds has the third worst air quality in the UK and has recently been warned over exceeding World Health Organisation's air quality limits.
attributes.additional_details: Today it as been announced that central government aren't going to back a mass transit system that, however flawed it was, would have gone some way to improving these issues. These plans were ten years and £60m in the making. Please  sign this petition if you believe that local MPs, councillors and the DfT should be compelled to produce a plan and find the funding for an immediate transport intervention for Leeds and the city region.

attributes.action: Reduce 6 weeks hols to 5, let kids chose their 6th week.
attributes.background: Reduce  6 weeks hols to 5 and let children choose a 6th week to go on holiday during term time as long as it doesn't coincide with exams or tests.
attributes.additional_details: Holiday companies are charging extortionate prices during school holidays and we are not allowed to keep children off school during term time, this would be an ideal solution.

attributes.action: Relax UK Drone Rules
attributes.background:
The rules regarding flying drones in the United States have been greatly relaxed, paving the way for thousands of businesses to fly legally in the country's airspace.

We the signed would like to see the United Kingdom take similar steps for us Drone flyers!

attributes.action: Organise a Brexit referendum for 15 to 17 year olds
attributes.background: I am a 15 year old girl who feels that her future has been ignored by those voting in the Brexit referendum. I believe we can show the government that the outcome could have been very different if our views had been taken into account.

attributes.action: Call on the Government to Trigger Article 50 and repeal EC Act 1972.
attributes.background: We live in a Democracy and the EU Referendum result should be honoured by the Government.  Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty must be triggered and the European Communities Act 1972 should be repealed.

attributes.action: to make immigrants work and pay tax for 4 years before they can claim benefits.
attributes.background: this is one of the big reasons why people chose to voted out of the EU, we have now chosen to leave the EU and we should no longer be giving immigrants housing benefits, working tax credits or job seekers allowance from a system that they have never paid into. This should be stoped immediately.
attributes.additional_details: we have a great benefits system that is here to help British citizens, the system was not put in place to pay people money for doing nothing, if an immigrant wants to claim any benefits they should have been living, working and paying tax into the system for 4 years minimum before they can claim any benifits.

attributes.action: Allow people resident in UK for 5 years to vote in the 2nd EU Referendum
attributes.background: Non British citizen resident in UK for more than 5 years are a vital part of this country as they are taxpayers and contributing actively to the future of the country. By law they could ask to become British citizens so it's only fair to give them the right to vote in such an important Referendum.

attributes.action: Transport Minister Patrick McLoughlin Cap Or Further Subsidise Train Fares
attributes.background: Train fares are just too costly for the average commuter/traveller. 35 minutes away from a main city can cost a yearly total of £3,320.00 which accounts for 12.7% of the average national salary. This figure is too high and continues to increase. Hence, we are calling on a cap or further subsidy.
attributes.additional_details:
"Since privatisation, the average price of a train journey has increased by 22% and walk-on tickets on some routes have been hiked by 245%. The TUC looked at the cost of UK rail commutes against similar European journeys in France, Germany and Spain. It found that we’re paying 3x more of our salary just to get to work and back." - (The Independent) 
http://www.independent.co.uk/travel/uk/why-are-uk-rail-fares-so-expensive-9678640.html

attributes.action: Stop Criminalizing/Banning U.K Drivers For Smoking Cannabis Days Before Driving.
attributes.background: Cannabis Users Are Being Driven Off Of The U.K Roads In Staggering Numbers Due To Smoking Cannabis Days Before Driving Why ?
attributes.additional_details:
The Governments Own Drug Advisor's State That Cannabis Can Take Up To 10 Days To Leave The System With Other Sources Saying Up To 67 Days In Chronic Users  
https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/marijuana-facts-teens/want-to-know-more-some-faqs-about-marijuana

While The Nhs Say It Can Show For Weeks 
https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/marijuana-facts-teens/want-to-know-more-some-faqs-about-marijuana

And As The High From Cannabis Last No Longer Then A Few Hours How Is This Fair.

attributes.action: Calling for government to pressure foreign governments to stop child soldiers.
attributes.background: The use of chid soldiers in developing countries is worrying. They are used to murder civilians and soldiers alike. In many cases the children would be forced to slaughter there own families. Before the age of 18 they are already in war. we need to fix this.
attributes.additional_details: Currently there is an estimated 250,000 child soldiers, that have been recruited by both governments and rebel groups. Often the children would be forced to murder a family member to sever there connections with community. This makes it hard for them to ever return home. In 10 years; 10 million children have suffered from psychological trauma, 2 million children have been murdered, one million children have been left orphaned and a further 2 million have suffered from life altering injuries.

attributes.action: Reverse the 40% tax threshold increase & apply savings to disability benefits
attributes.background: I am a 40% taxpayer.  From 2017 I will be better off by £141.50 a year by virtue of increases to the 40% tax threshold.  I don't need this money but many others do.  Savings from reversing this increase should be applied to those who have recently had their benefits slashed - the disabled.
attributes.additional_details: My annual savings have been calculated using online calculators such as that published by The Independent http://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/news/budget-2016-use-our-calculator-to-work-out-how-the-tax-changes-affect-you-a6934526.html and reports of cuts to the Personal Independence Payment http://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/mar/13/cuts-will-see-200000-disabled-people-lose-3000-a-year

attributes.action: Increase funding on nursing homes to lower the cost of carehomes for families.
attributes.background: We visited a nursing home and were disheartened by the patients' solitude. Our hearts were torn by watching the elderly in care being so fragile and frail, armed with the knowledge that they receive such little funding. So we have started a campaign in conjunction with this

attributes.action: Make the minimum hourly wage for residential & domicilary care workers £10phr.
attributes.background: I'm shocked and appalled at the hourly rate of pay offered by care homes. Most start at the current minimum wage of £7.20phr, it's known some pay as little as £5.00phr. The work is incredibly demanding mentally, physically and emotionally, & one which vulnerable adults rely entirely on their carers.
attributes.additional_details:
Over the years there have been a number of newspaper articles chronicling the poor wages on offer to care workers. Such as in the Independent, guardian & on the bbc websites.
By paying a more realistic and professional hourly rate:
- The industry can and will attract better quality carers who will feel valued and see the job as a profession.
- Those being cared for will be getting the best carers. 
- It would help reduce the number of families claiming Tax credits, to supplement their income.

attributes.action: Stop The Council Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays!
attributes.background:
I was given 3 separate tickets for driving in a bus lane on a Bank Holiday by Harrow Council, each a few seconds apart.

I do not drive on bus lanes but after my investigation, I realised it was on a bank holiday and I must have assumed because it was bank holiday the same rules on Sunday applies.
attributes.additional_details:
Stop The Council from issuing Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays!

There are many motorists with the same stories. 

http://www.govyou.co.uk/remove-the-ambiguity-re-bank-holiday-use-of-bus-lanes/

http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/local-news/warning-reveal-number-drivers-fined-8789712

attributes.action: Limit paying out Child Benefit to the first two children only.
attributes.background:
As the law stands, Child Benefit can be paid out to people who have children. This may or may not be the parents.
The payment for the first child is currently £20.70
For each additional child, it is £13.70 per child.
We believe that Child Benefit should be limited to the first two children only.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that benefits are in the gift of the Government.
As the law currently stands, Child Benefit is paid at the rate of £20.70 for the first child and £13.70 for each additional child.
We believe that this needs to change and that the Government should legislate to limit the payout of Child Benefit to the first two children only.
This would reduce the benefits bill and the burden on the taxpayers.
People who wish to have more than two children should not expect the state to pay for them.

attributes.action: Outlaw mobile safety cameras or prove they improve road safety
attributes.background: Mobile safety cameras or mobile speed cameras, they appear in places with no warnings to motorists, fine if you're not speeding but prove that they are improving road safety! Where I live accidents are minimal we have no speed cameras just the van that shows up and no warning signs before you see it
attributes.additional_details: It's about time a proper debate was had about these! If they are just to target those who pay no attention place a sign before it can target a motorist let them know there is a police operation in progress! Show is proof that they actually improve road safety and reduce accidents in areas they are used! Modern technology on cars does though that has been proven time and time again! Raise speed limits of you are to continue to use these cash cows or give plausible warnings that they are in action

attributes.action: Make sure refugees and immigrants are vaccinated to the same standard as uk
attributes.background: We are now seeing cases of bugs and diseases that's not been an issue for years in UK. Our children are starting to suffer for longer periods and more often. As a parent I'm getting concerned about about my children's health and have a 3 year old that's constantly getting ill
attributes.additional_details: As the country is allowing refugees and immigrants from various locations it's time to think of our children's health welfare and theirs. We need to ensure our children don't pick up various bugs that have become less common in the last 20 years or so. Please support us to petition the government to ensure all new British citizens are given vaccinations up to the level that we all are

attributes.action: Govt is not entitled to hold a view on the EU referendum, only individuals.
attributes.background: We the undersigned, believe it is unconstitutional and wholly inappropriate, for the UK govt to hold an opinion (Either way) on the potential outcome of the EU referendum and it is certainly not right, to instruct Civil Servants that they may not speak freely on the matter, as they so believe.
attributes.additional_details: We live in a Constitutional Monarchy, with Parliamentary Democracy, however the recent actions of Mr Cameron have turned this country into a Banana Republic. At the very least, Parliament should first debate, whether or not it is right for the Government to use the Civil Service, the way it is intending to, in the lead up to this referendum. Rigging the entire debate as Government, is not providing a free, fair and impartial debate on the issue, to the people, which is what it should be.

attributes.action: Parliament debates the legality of EU treaties with regard to Vienna Convention.
attributes.background:
Article 53, Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties: 1969 states:  'A treaty is void if, at the time of its conclusion, it conflicts with a peremptory norm of general international law.'  

Peremptory norm includes the removal of sovereignty and the removal of law not specifically repealed.
attributes.additional_details:
It is recognised that EU Treaties entail removal of National Sovereignty and abrogate National Law not specifically repealed which includes the Treason Laws.   Parliament is sovereign except that it shall not diminish its own sovereignty.

As Parliament at various times has seen fit to transfer sovereignty to the EU, it is illegal under International Law and should cease forthwith including any procedures laid down by the EU for secession from the EU and withdraw unilaterally,

attributes.action:
ban cycle racing on the public roads
And make cyclist use the cycle paths
attributes.background: I was driving the other day just come round the bend and there was 3 of them next to eachover taking up the road and could not pass its so dangerous
attributes.additional_details:
ban cycle racing on the public roads
I would like the government to ban cycle racing on public roads. On our busy streets their is no place for sports cycle racing, its highly dangerous with cyclists often racing three abreast and not moving in on narrow roads to allow faster traffic to pass. clubs should rent tracks to race on cars and motorbikes have to , cyclists pay no road tax,have no insurance etc, pleasure cycling and commuting should be encouraged on cycle paths only but racing banned

attributes.action: Extend NHS staff lunch breaks from 30 minutes to 1 hour, 30 minutes isn't enough
attributes.background: As you know NHS staff work under immense stress and pressure, saving lives on a daily basis. Staff working in these conditions should be given adequate time to get away from the department and relieve themselves of stress. Working under intense pressure without adequate rest can lead to fatigue.
attributes.additional_details: Working in stressful environments without adequate time to relax can lead to stress, fatigue and ultimately making mistakes which can put lives at risk, we believe staff should have enough time to get away from the department and unwind. 30 minutes is nowhere near enough time to leave the department, pick up lunch and then have time to eat before being late back for shift. We propose that lunch breaks should be extended to 1 hour or 45 minutes at the least to ensure staff have time to eat,relax.

attributes.action: Make rear facing law till 2
attributes.background: As research shows its 10x safer for a child to be rear facing up to 2 sometimes 4 unfortunately a lot of people are to quick to put their babies into forward facing at 9+ months which in an accident can have devastating consequences! Whereas rear facing children will more than likely have a bruise

attributes.action: Stop Prison 'Reform' from going ahead. More rights for victims please!
attributes.background: The Queen detailed prison reform in her speech today, which includes giving prisoners the right to live at home on weekdays and free iPads with Skype to contact family while serving time. This is not punishment and makes a joke of the victim's rights.

attributes.action: Make taking pictures of children in public without carers consent illegal
attributes.background: My 3yr old neice was photographed at the beach by a stranger, she was specifically targeted, the man followed her around to take the pics, the police were called but because no crime had been commited the man walked free with his phone and there was an uncertainty as to whether the pics were deleted
attributes.additional_details:
Children are extremely vulnerable and I feel that by it being legal for strangers to target and photograph them, this puts them in an even more vulnerable state.
It should not be right for strangers to be allowed to have photographs of our children on their phones. This needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: The Education Secretary should be required to have had real teaching experience
attributes.background: Having 'once been to school' (and especially if it was a fee-paying school) is not a qualification for setting state policy for education. The current and past Education Secretaries generally have no understanding of the pressures faced by modern teachers or pupils.
attributes.additional_details: I recently signed a petition regarding a specific decision on education policy. However, I realised that none of the nonsensical and impractical decision-making would change until someone with a working, practical knowledge of life in a school and classroom takes charge. I would add an addendum that a significant proportion of the executive staff of the Department for Education should also have teaching experience. Education is too important to be a political football for short-term gain.

attributes.action: Funding for every primary school to employ a primary PE teacher
attributes.background: Most primary schools are funded around £9000 per year as a sports premium. From my experience I believe this should be increased and the funding should include the cost of a fully qualified PE teacher to teach curriculum PE in all primary schools.
attributes.additional_details: The benefits of this include; All pupils having a great start in physical education from the age of 4, raise the quality and amount of competitive sport in primary schools, be on par with private school education.

attributes.action: TRADE DEAL with EU after BREXIT must prohibit unrestricted immigration
attributes.background:
We are told it may take10 years to negotiate a deal with the EU after we vote to leave. NO - Draft the deal now. 

Give them some great trading terms.  However, it MUST NOT be in return for the same unrestricted immigration as we have now and we must not be required to pay them money for nothing.
attributes.additional_details:
You must listen to the population of this country and if we have voted to leave it will be because.....

1) We want to limit the people that arrive in the UK from around the world based on a fair system we can control.

2) We do not want to be a net contributor to the EU or anywhere for that matter. We want our billions spent in the UK.

3) We want to make our own laws, which is what generations of British people have fought and died for over the centuries.

You are hereby tasked with delivery

attributes.action: Change wording from father and mother to parents on all legal certificates.
attributes.background: In 2014 a bill was won to include mothers names on marriage certificates, this still doesn't reflect the way we live, as some families will be made up of two mothers or two fathers and legal guardians who are ALL the parents of the children.
attributes.additional_details: Yet on many if not all legal certificates and documents only space is there for one mother or one father and then an additional space for parent. If or when a child decides to marry they too will be faced with who to name, as there is space for only one of their mothers or fathers, by changing the wording to parents this will avoid the confusion and recognise the make up of their family.

attributes.action: Repeal Scotland Act 1998 and 2016 Amendments and dissolve Holyrood
attributes.background: On 26th June First Minister Nicola Sturgeon threatened to veto UK succession from the EU despite the country voting by over 1.2 million votes to leave. Such action is in contravention to democratic will. Westminster should reverse Scottish devolution to prevent the SNP's constitutional overreach

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for alcoholic drinks to display it's nutritional information
attributes.background: It is the law to display nutritional information on all food and drink except for alcoholic drinks. Many people use this information for any dietary issues they may have, from a simple diet to type 1 diabetes. Without nutritional information it is impossible to consume alcohol for some people.
attributes.additional_details: Alcohol is extremely calorific and I believe people would change their views on how much they drink if they knew what was in what they drink. Also being diabetic myself, I have to use insulin depending on how much carbohydrate I consume, which is impossible to know with alcohol, and could pose and extremely dangerous health risk.

attributes.action: Include tattoo, body piercings & hair colour in the anti-discrimination act.
attributes.background: In an age that wants us to be accepting of unconventional values, it should be law for employers to refuse you an interview or a job for creative physical expression.
attributes.additional_details: Tattoos, body piercings and diverse hair colours are an act of freedom and self expression in a linear society that wants us to conform to physical norm. They do not affect the level of service we provide to our work sectors and every individual should be able to physically express themselves however they want no matter what job they do. It should be law as part of the anti-discrimination act to be accepting towards those with any tattoos on the body, any hair colour and any piercings.

attributes.action: Stop taxing hard working people on their overtime. Tax on basic 40hrs only
attributes.background: Over time should be tax free as people don't want to do it but for most it's a must to help them live.

attributes.action: Fund university expenditure for the production of radiolabelled Vitamin B12
attributes.background:
People with Vitamin B12 deficiency caused by Pernicious Anaemia have problems with diagnosis because the available tests are inaccurate.

The Schilling Test can accurately diagnose the cause of Vitamin B12 but is no longer performed because nobody makes the radiolabeled cobalt required.
attributes.additional_details:
Vitamin B12 blood tests are inaccurate. The test for the antibodies responsible for PA is only accurate 50% of the time.

The Schilling Test requires radiolabelled cobalt. A government-sponsored source could make it possible to reinstate this test.



Reference for inaccuracy of tests - 
http://www.bcshguidelines.com/documents/BCSH_Cobalamin_and_Folate_Guidelines_(2).docx.pdf
Reference for Schilling Test - 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schilling_test

attributes.action: Prevent sex offenders changing their legal name under which they were convicted.
attributes.background: A recent FOI request has proven that MORE than 800 sex offenders have changed their names to hide their crimes in the last 5 years, including 83 rapists and 126 perverts convicted of possessing or distributing child abuse images, and 88 were convicted of indecent assault and 44 of sexual assault.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/news/7138397/Sex-offenders-hide-and-change-their-name.html

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3582349/More-800-British-sex-offenders-changed-names-hide-dark-past-police-REFUSE-tell-protect-perverts-rights.html

attributes.action:
Make large corporations with "off shore" activity pay a 30% 
UK operating tax.
attributes.background: Corporations that operate in the UK can legally get away with out paying any tax to the state by going through various loop holes in the system. So we are calling for OUR government, people that we have put in place to work for US, we the people to charge these companies a UK operating tax of 30%
attributes.additional_details: The rate of 30% is to be paid from profits of said company and will be estimated by the government and checked with the companies own accounts and billed to the off shore company. (Much like when the HMRC decides how much tax a UK citizen should have paid if there is any discrepancy in end of year  accounts.)  If the company disagrees then they will be served a notice to close all remaining branches and leave the country.

attributes.action: Ensure councils have adequate maintenance funding so Parkruns can remain free
attributes.background: Parkruns are free for people of all ages and abilities, providing benefits for health and the community. Stoke Gifford Parish Council have voted to charge Parkrun. Its free nature means many who otherwise wouldn't or can't participate have made positive impacts on their health and community
attributes.additional_details: Promoting health and exercise will save the government money on the NHS and help keep people healthy

attributes.action: The government must also put case for leaving the EU on it's referendum leaflet.
attributes.background: I believe that democracy should be fair and that this country should have an honest referendum on it's membership of the EU without the government using tax payers money to fund one side of the argument in a blatant attempt to sway voters to the remain side.
attributes.additional_details: The government is spending £9million on a referendum leaflet.

attributes.action: All multiple occupancy premises must have a fully operational defibrillator.
attributes.background:
Out of hospital cardiac arrests kill more people annually than fire does. 
Make it a legal requirement for all government and commercial multiple occupancy premises, having either a fixed or transitory population, to keep and maintain a fully operational defibrillator.
attributes.additional_details: Fire Extinguishers are compulsory in many buildings; 2013-14 there were 322 fire-related deaths in the UK(Source: UK Gov) but it is estimated that there are about 60k out of hospital cardiac arrests in the UK annually. 30k are discovered in time to help save the victim’s life(Source: BHF). If response time for using defibrillators was shortened to within 8 minutes it would save the lives of 15 out of 100 people who collapse with cardiac arrest.(Source: Milan, Brescia and Washington Universities)

attributes.action: Ban mobile phones in the House
attributes.background: After seeing the reactions to the call for George Osborne to apologise all we can see from the Tory front bench is laughing at their mobile phones and texting. The use of mobile phones at work is generally banned and I think the same rule should stand in Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ygQykstDk2w

attributes.action: Ban the use of neonicotinoids in the UK
attributes.background: 37 MILLION BEES (600 HIVES) FOUND DEAD AFTER PLANTING LARGE GMO CORN FIELD TREATED WITH NEONICOTINOID CLASS OF PESTICIDES IN CANADA.
attributes.additional_details: http://jbanews.com/2016/02/27/37-million-bees-found-dead-after-planting-large-gmo-corn-field-treated-with-neonicotinoid-class-of-pesticides/

attributes.action: The derogatory term 'Kufar' used to describe 'Non Muslims' should be banned.
attributes.background: We are constantly reminded of what is 'Politically correct' when discussing anything to do with Islam. We find the word used against us by some members of the Islamic faith totally unacceptable and offensive. Other faiths should  be regarded with the same respect that the followers of Islam expect.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3751080/The-face-hatred-unveiled-Wife-jailed-Choudary-clearly-identified-time-vows-non-Muslims-Britain-destroyed.html
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6DsG9yQrdD4

http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=Kuffar

The people are tired of the British Government having a 'Two tier' system. We should all be respected equally. We have a right to be treated equally . Allowing this derogatory term to be used in public should be treated as a hate crime.

attributes.action: Change the motorway speed limit to 85 MPH.
attributes.background: The problem with motorways in UK that I find is that we have roads of good enough standard and management that could take up faster traffic.  I Really find a problem where it is allowed to go up to 60 MPH on a narrow road with sharp bends but only 70 MPH on wide and safe motorway.
attributes.additional_details:
Many other countries in europe have much higher motorway speed limit  road conditions: Belgium (74MPH), France, Austria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Poland (80 MPH), Germany (NONE - unless stated otherwise)
In some of those countries where the speed limit of 80 MPH applies the motorway road conditions are far much worse than in United Kingdom.

attributes.action: No action to leave the EU until Parliament has approved  alternative policy
attributes.background: No detailed alternative policy on relations with EU was set out in referendum. Our elected representatives should approve one as a basis for negotiation with the EU before Article 50 or other measures are initiated to trigger departure

attributes.action: Reduce Foreign Aid - divert to, Health, Police, Military, and Pensioners
attributes.background: Foreign aid 11 billion budget to increase by £1 billion (That is money the UK Government borrows to give away).The UK  spends more than any other country and is the second largest aid donor in the world (The Telegraph)  Despite in 2015 UK government debt amounted to £1.56 trillion(economicshelp.org)
attributes.additional_details:
In January, it emerged that civil servants had gone on a £1billion spending spree over eight weeks last year to hit the government target of allocating 0.7 per cent of national income to overseas aid.
BRITAIN's spending on foreign aid will be LARGER than the entire Home Office budget in each of the next five years - reaching a staggering £16BILLION, it was revealed. Pakistan who is a Nuclear Power and not so long ago bought a fleet of fighters off the USA get the highest amount 351 million.

attributes.action: Allow Doctors to Issue Temporary Disabled Parking Badges
attributes.background: Many people leave hospital and are vulnerable and have extremely limited mobility. I believe GPs and Doctors should be able to issue temporary Disabled Parking Badges to help people with temporary issues
attributes.additional_details:
Many people leave hospital have had invasive or life changing surgery and are signed off work for weeks or even moths to recover. During this time no provision is made to help them access shops, pharmacists or even hospitals!

I would like to empower Doctors to issue temporary Disabled Parking Badges to help post operative patients rehabilitate.

These badges would give the bearer the same access rights as the current Disabled Badge scheme however they would expire as patients recover.

attributes.action: Recognition of the Armenian Genocide
attributes.background: I would like HM Government to recognise the events that overtook the Armenian population [of what is now E Turkey] around 1915 as 'genocide'. HM Government to follow the lead of EU partners - such as France & Austria - who already recognise those events as 'genocide'.
attributes.additional_details:
As part of a parliamentary discussion, MPs should consider whether the terrible Jewish holocaust/genocide differs from that which overtook the Armenia population [of E Turkey] around 1915. Nearly two million innocent people were killed during those events.

Furthermore, why, since the Jewish genocide has been officially recognised by HM Government, is it the case that the Armenian genocide remains unacknowledged - given the criteria set down in the 1942 UN declaration on Genocide?

attributes.action: Introduce Helen’s Law where hiding a body becomes a criminal offence
attributes.background: To lose a loved one to murder is horrific. To be denied their funeral causes unimaginable suffering. Ian Simms is serving a life sentence for the murder of  Helen McCourt, aged 22, on 9 February 1988, in Billinge, Lancs. Simms has always refused to reveal the whereabouts of Helen’s body.
attributes.additional_details:
The case made legal history as only the third ever UK murder trial without a body and was one of the first in the UK to use DNA fingerprinting.

As it currently stands, the English legal system does not require a convicted murderer to admit guilt or reveal the location of a victim’s remains before being released. 

We hereby ask the government to acknowledge the pain and distress caused to the families of missing murder victims by:
1. Denying parole to murderers for as long as they refuse to disclose the whereabouts of their victim’s remains
2. Passing a full life tariff (denying parole or release) until the murderer discloses the location (and enables the recovery) of their victim’s remains

Denying a funeral is, surely, an infringement of basic human rights.

attributes.action: Scrap 20% VAT on memorial headstones and the service provided by memorial masons
attributes.background:
Recently my 5 year daughter 'fell asleep' and i was shocked to find out that VAT is applied on memorial headstones ,memorial vases etc. 
How is VAT allowed in the first place, could someone explain to me how its a value added tax when you lose someone suddenly and unexpectedly.
attributes.additional_details: Currently charities and faith groups are allowed to claim back VAT through the Memorial Grant Scheme so can this not be opened up to the general public or VAT not applied or together.

attributes.action: Admit all children with a British connection to the UK from the French camps.
attributes.background: The clearance policy agreed by French courts and the French government's use of water cannon in executing it in these weather conditions, is against common humanity.
